required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Patient Positions for Locating the Cricothyroid Membrane
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Patient Positions for Locating the Cricothyroid Membrane

brief_summary.textblock: Cricothyroidotomy is an emergency rescue technique to secure the airway in a 'Can't intubate, Can't Oxygenate' (CICO) situation. The cricothyroid membrane (CTM) is the target site of cricothyroidotomy, and accurate identification of the CTM is essential for successful cricothyroidotomy. In this study, the investigators compare patient positions (neck extension vs. modified ramped position) in terms of the success rate for identifying the CTM in obese patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Success rate for the correct identification of the cricothyroid membrane
primary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after identifying the cricothyroid membrane using a laryngeal handshake technique
primary_outcome.description: After identifying the cricothyroid membrane using a laryngeal handshake technique in different head positions, an assessor evaluates the correctness of its localization using ultrasound.

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration for identifying the cricothyroid membrane
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 90 seconds after administering neuromuscular blockade
secondary_outcome.description: Time taken to locate the cricothyroid membrane is checked.

secondary_outcome.measure: Distances between the center of the actual and perceived cricothyroid membrane
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after identifying the cricothyroid membrane using a laryngeal handshake technique
secondary_outcome.description: Distances between the center of the actual and perceived cricothyroid membrane is measured using ultrasound.

secondary_outcome.measure: Perceived difficulty during cricothyroid membrane identification
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 5 minutes after identifying the cricothyroid membrane using a laryngeal handshake technique
secondary_outcome.description: Anatomical difficulty perceived by the anesthesiologists during cricothyroid membrane identification is assessed (1, very easy; 2, easy; 3, moderate; 4, difficult; and 5, very difficult).

arm_group.description: The cricothyroid membrane is identified in a neck extended position.
The cricothyroid membrane is identified in a modified ramped position.

intervention.description: The cricothyroid membrane is identified using a laryngeal handshake technique in different patient positions.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- body mass index >30 kg/m2
Exclusion Criteria:
- anatomical abnormalities or pathologies of the neck or larynx
- a history of neck surgery.
